# cm010 - November 1, 2018

## Overview

* Define a continuous random variable
* Identify continuous random variable distributions relevant to social science
* Define expected value and variance of continuous random variables
* Relate continuous random variables to discrete random variables
* Define cumulative distribution functions (CDFs) for continuous random variables and compare to discrete random variables
* Explain how to condition random variables on events and other random variables

## Before class

* Read [chapters 2-3 (Random Variables and Expectation) in *All of Statistics*](https://link-springer-com.proxy.uchicago.edu/book/10.1007%2F978-0-387-21736-9) (UChicago authentication required)
    * Focus primarily on content related to **continuous** random variables
